en: Efficiency is the dominant idea in business.
Such a business failure would sink any company.
ko: 그런 사업 실패면 어떤 회사라도 무너뜨릴 거야.

en: Trade is getting depressed.
The business is slow.
Shops are quiet on weekdays.
The shop did not want him.
ko: 그 가게에서는 그 사람을 반기지 않았어.

en: The shops were bad, but the factory was worse.
The first session of the trade negotiations is at ten o'clock tomorrow morning.
ko: 내일 오전 10시에 첫 무역 협상이 열려.

en: Shall we shoot the breeze for a while before talking business?
ko: 일 얘기 하기 전에 수다나 좀 떨까?

en: The dealer took advantage of her ignorance and bought the picture very cheap.
ko: 그 장사꾼은 그녀가 잘 모르는 걸 이용해서 그림을 아주 싸게 샀어.

en: A merchant is a person who buys and sells goods.
The merchant sent the politician a bribe.
The merchant bribed the politician.
Trade companies aim at a new market in Asia.
ko: 무역 회사들은 아시아의 새로운 시장을 노리고 있어.

en: In the case of commercial airplanes, private companies compete to sell their product.
ko: 민간 항공기의 경우, 사기업들이 자기네 제품을 팔려고 경쟁해.

en: Commerce led to the development of cities.
The soul of commerce is upright dealing.
Commercial television is an effective medium for advertising.
ko: 상업용 TV는 광고하기에 아주 효과적인 매체야.

en: Treat your servant more kindly.
Don't hesitate to tell me if there is anything you would like to eat.
ko: 먹고 싶은 거 있으면 망설이지 말고 말해.

en: The servant swept the floor.
The servant gradually adjusted to his new surroundings.
We're confident of our victory.
We fought hard for victory.
The victory made him a hero.
Victory is unlikely but not impossible.
The day is ours without doubt.
The victory is ours.
The victory made us more excited.
It is important for us to learn to handle defeats as well as triumphs properly.
ko: 승리뿐만 아니라 패배도 제대로 받아들이는 법을 배우는 게 중요해.

en: The report of victory turned out to be a little premature.
Everyone got excited by the news of the victory.
On hearing of the victory, the whole nation shouted for joy.
ko: 승리 소식을 듣고 온 나라가 기뻐서 소리쳤어.

en: All hope of winning the game vanished.
Her efforts were crowned with victory.
The match ended in a draw.
It doesn't matter whether you win or not.
The chances are even.
Don't enter at the kitchen door.
Don't try to duck out early. Where's your sense of responsibility?
ko: 일찍 빠지려고 하지 마. 책임감이 어딨어?

en: Don't let your imagination run wild.
Have it your way.
It is good to be a winner.
Katsuko leads her class in English.
Masaru doesn't care for this color.
ko: 마사루는 이 색깔을 별로 안 좋아해.

en: Masaru can't finish the work in an hour, can he?
ko: 마사루가 그 일을 한 시간 안에 끝낼 순 없겠지?

en: Whether you win or lose, you should do your best in the match.
ko: 이기든 지든 경기에서는 최선을 다해야 해.

en: Whether we win or lose, we must play fairly.
ko: 이기든 지든 우린 정정당당하게 경기해야 해.

en: Whether you win or lose, you should play fairly.
Do your best whether you win or lose.
If you win, you are in the right, but if you lose, you are in the wrong.
ko: 이기면 옳은 거고 지면 틀린 게 돼.

en: Success is never blamed.
We have no expectations of victory.
We have no chance of winning.
There's an outside chance of winning.
Some will gain, others will lose.
ko: 얻는 게 있으면 잃는 것도 있는 법이야.

en: You must keep up your guard even after a victory.
Whether you win or lose, you must play fair.
The chances of victory or defeat are even.
Best of luck in your tournament.
The scar shows clearly.
Let me see your wound.
The wound discharged pus.
Blood ran from the wound.
Don't touch the wound.
Search not the wound too deep lest thou make a new one.
ko: 상처를 너무 깊이 파헤치지 마, 새로운 상처가 생길 수도 있으니까.

en: To avoid spoiling, fish caught far out at sea are immediately cooled or even frozen.
ko: 먼 바다에서 잡은 생선은 상하지 않게 바로 냉각하거나 얼려.

en: When out at sea, to keep the fish that is caught from spoiling, it is immediately refrigerated.
ko: 바다에서 잡은 생선이 상하지 않도록 바로 냉장 보관해.

en: The wound was fatal to him.
The wound has not yet healed.
The wound is not yet healed.
The injured bird fell to the ground.
Pus has formed in the wound.
Stop the flow of blood from the wound.
ko: 상처에서 피 나는 것 좀 멈추게 해줘.

en: Do something about the flow of blood from the wound.
ko: 상처에서 피 흐르는 것 좀 어떻게 해봐.

en: The wound won't close.
I was aching from the injury.
Will I have a scar?
Call a spade a spade.
By degrees the friendship between him and her grew into love.
ko: 그와 그녀의 우정은 서서히 사랑으로 변했어.

en: How does the preface run?
In the introduction, the author is stating as follows.
ko: 서문에서 저자는 다음과 같이 말하고 있어.

en: All the girls around her say she's got it coming.
ko: 주변 여자애들은 다 걔가 자초한 일이라고 말해.

en: The actress tore up her contract angrily.
ko: 그 여배우는 화가 나서 계약서를 찢어버렸어.

en: The actress fell backward over the stage.
The actress fell backwards from the stage.
My wife's hands are slightly smaller than the shop assistant's.
ko: 우리 아내 손이 점원 손보다 조금 더 작아.

en: Many times, a hen-pecked husband doesn't know his problems until he talks to a happy bachelor.
ko: 공처가들은 행복한 독신남이랑 얘기해보기 전까지는 자기 문제가 뭔지 모르는 경우가 많아.

en: A bad wife is the shipwreck of her husband.
Were you shouting at my wife?
My wife burst into tears.

Knowing very well that his wife wanted to go to a movie, the husband, who was a dog in the manger, cooked up a scheme whereby they had to stay at home waiting for a certain visitor who was not expected to come.
ko: 아내가 영화 보고 싶어 하는 걸 뻔히 알면서도, 그 심술궂은 남편은 오지도 않을 손님을 기다려야 한다며 집에 있게끔 수를 썼어.

en: The shopwoman showed me a lot of neckties, but I didn't like any of them.
ko: 점원이 넥타이를 많이 보여줬는데, 하나도 맘에 안 들었어.

en: The maid was totally tired of her household routine.
ko: 가사 도우미는 반복되는 집안일에 완전히 질려버렸어.

en: Can't you just picture Ed in woman's disguise?
The changes resulting from the women's movement have affected both women and men.
ko: 여성 운동으로 인한 변화는 남녀 모두에게 영향을 미쳤어.

en: Never keep a lady waiting.
There were few colleges to educate women.
ko: 여성을 교육할 수 있는 대학이 거의 없었어.

en: Women are easily moved to tears.
Women have been resigned to unjust treatment for too long.
ko: 여자들은 너무 오랫동안 부당한 대우를 그냥 받아들여 왔어요.

en: Women automatically lose interest in him after exchanging a couple of words.
ko: 여자들은 걔랑 몇 마디만 나눠봐도 바로 정떨어져 해요.

en: Women usually live longer than men.
ko: 보통 여자들이 남자보다 더 오래 살아요.

en: Women commonly live longer than men.
ko: 여자들이 남자보다 오래 사는 게 일반적이에요.

en: It is said that women live longer than men.
Women tend to live longer than men.
ko: 여자들이 남자보다 더 오래 사는 편이에요.

en: Women are employed at a lower salary than men.
ko: 여자들이 남자보다 적은 연봉을 받고 고용돼요.

en: Women want equality of opportunity with men.
Women are physically weaker than men.
Women use talking to maintain personal relationships.
Since women are taking on more responsibilities at work and in the community, it is said that the number of women with stress from both child-rearing and work is increasing.
ko: 사회 활동이 많아지면서 육아와 일을 병행하느라 스트레스받는 여성들이 늘고 있대요.

en: Must the woman always play the secondary role?
ko: 왜 항상 여자가 보조적인 역할만 해야 하나요?

en: Women are said to be weak at figures.
Men usually like wrestling as women do not.
ko: 여자들이 안 좋아하는 레슬링을 보통 남자들은 좋아해요.

en: Women no longer are satisfied with their traditional role of housewife, and are seeking recognition of needs in the workplace.
ko: 이제 여자들은 전업주부라는 전통적인 역할에만 만족하지 않고 사회적 인정을 원해요.

en: Women generally live longer than men.
Why aren't women allowed to enjoy the same civil rights as men?
ko: 왜 여자들은 남자와 똑같은 시민권을 누릴 수 없는 건가요?

en: Most women enjoy shopping.
Women tend to fuss over trifling matters.
ko: 여자들은 사소한 일에 신경을 많이 쓰는 편이에요.

en: "I forgot," she answered.
She wanted to know if the photographer could remove the hat from the picture.
ko: 그녀는 사진사가 사진에서 모자를 지워줄 수 있는지 알고 싶어 했어요.

en: The position of women, over the years, has definitely changed for the better.
ko: 지난 몇 년간 여성의 지위는 확실히 더 나아졌어요.

en: Woman's intuition is clearly a valuable trait.
ko: 여자의 직감은 분명히 가치 있는 특성이에요.

en: Do you have any sisters?
Women's rights groups are going after sexual harassment.
ko: 여성 단체들이 성희롱 문제에 대응하고 있어요.

en: How about holding a debate on women's rights?
ko: 여성 인권에 대해 토론해 보는 건 어때요?

en: We should not ask a woman her age.
Women talk about trivial things when talking with men.
ko: 여자들은 남자랑 얘기할 때 사소한 것들에 대해 말해요.

en: Some women are quick at figures.
Woman as she is, she can lift this barbell.
ko: 여자인데도 이 바벨을 거뜬히 들 수 있어요.

en: A woman is giving a book a quick once-over.
It is quite common for women to go out to work.
ko: 여자들이 직장에 다니는 건 아주 흔한 일이에요.

en: A woman was driving a car on a country road.
ko: 한 여자가 시골길에서 차를 몰고 있었어요.

en: What accounts for the fact that women outlive men?
ko: 여자들이 남자보다 오래 사는 이유가 도대체 뭘까요?

en: I wonder why women outlive men.
ko: 왜 여자들이 남자보다 더 오래 사는지 궁금해요.

en: I wonder why women live longer than men.
ko: 왜 여자들이 남자보다 수명이 긴지 궁금해요.

en: It took some 150 years of struggling for women to gain the freedom they have today.
ko: 여성들이 지금의 자유를 얻기까지는 약 150년의 투쟁이 필요했어요.

en: A woman is taking down some notes on a pad of paper.
ko: 한 여자가 메모지에 무언가를 적고 있어요.

en: Career opportunities, flex-time, satellite offices, and more childcare facilities are required to make women at home join the work force.
ko: 주부들의 사회 진출을 위해서는 취업 기회, 유연 근무제, 보육 시설 확충 등이 필요해요.

en: A woman's mind and winter wind change oft.
ko: 여자의 마음과 겨울 바람은 갈대와 같아요.

en: A woman's mind and winter wind change often.
ko: 여자의 마음과 겨울 바람은 자주 바뀌죠.

en: A woman is a weathercock.
An office girl was robbed of an envelope containing 100,000 yen on her way back from the bank.
ko: 한 여직원이 은행에서 돌아오는 길에 10만 엔이 든 봉투를 날치기당했어요.

en: Where is the ladies' room? I want to wash my hands.
ko: 화장실이 어디예요? 손 좀 씻고 싶어서요.

en: The women's college had a very small car park, and as several of the teachers and students, and many of the student's boyfriends, had cars, it was often difficult to find a place to park.
ko: 그 여대는 주차장이 너무 좁았는데, 교수님들과 학생들, 그리고 학생 남자친구들까지 차를 가져와서 주차하기가 참 힘들었어요.

en: She was even more surprised when she heard Miss Baker say, "Excuse me, but may I change places with you?"
ko: 베이커 양이 "실례지만 저랑 자리 좀 바꿔 주실 수 있을까요?"라고 말하는 걸 듣고 그녀는 더 깜짝 놀랐어요.

en: Three cheers for my Queen!
May the queen live long!
Long live the Queen!
The Queen is to visit China next year.
The queen is going to address parliament next week.
ko: 여왕이 다음 주에 의회에서 연설할 거예요.

en: The queen visited the museum.
The queen shook hands with each player after the game.
ko: 여왕이 경기가 끝나고 선수들 한 명 한 명이랑 악수했어요.

en: The Queen made an address to the nation on television yesterday.
ko: 여왕이 어제 TV에서 대국민 연설을 했어요.

en: The Queen made an address to the nation.
The queen was richly appareled.
The queen was gracious enough to invite us.
The queen was wearing a magnificent silver dress.
ko: 여왕이 아주 멋진 은색 드레스를 입고 있었어요.

en: The part of the queen does not suit her.
ko: 여왕 역할이 그 여자분한테는 잘 안 어울려요.

en: An exhibition was given in anticipation of the Queen's visit.
They named the ship Queen Mary after the Queen.
ko: 여왕의 이름을 따서 배 이름을 '퀸 메리'호라고 지었대요.

en: A woman is the woe of man.
Women ought to be as glad to be women as men are to be men.
ko: 남자가 남자인 걸 기뻐하는 만큼 여자도 여자인 걸 기뻐해야 해요.

en: The woman tried on one hat after another, then left the hat shop.
ko: 그 여자는 모자를 이것저것 써보더니 그냥 가게를 나갔어요.

en: She rides to the black sabbath.
ko: 그 여자는 블랙 사바스 집회에 참석하러 가요.

en: She had nothing else to drink.
ko: 그 여자는 그거 말고는 마실 게 전혀 없었어요.

en: The woman reached for the knife on the table.
ko: 그 여자가 탁자 위에 있는 칼을 향해 손을 뻗었어요.

en: Women like to talk.
For a girl, after 30, it's downhill all the way.
A woman's hair is long; her tongue is longer.
ko: 여자는 머리카락은 길어도 혀는 더 길다는 말이 있어요.

en: How happy you must be to have a new baby girl!
A woman was hanging the washing on the line.
ko: 어떤 여자분이 빨래줄에 빨래를 널고 있었어요.

en: A woman was kind enough to show me the way.
ko: 어떤 여자분이 친절하게 길을 가르쳐 주셨어요.

en: The girls objected to our plan.
The girls burst into laughter when they heard his joke.
ko: 여자애들이 그 사람 농담을 듣고 빵 터졌어요.

en: All the girls helped each other.
Where are the girls?
The girls began to laugh when they heard the story.
ko: 여자애들은 그 이야기를 듣고 웃기 시작했어요.

en: The girls amused themselves playing games.
The girls couldn't wait to show off their fine needle work to us.
ko: 여자애들은 자기들이 한 바느질을 우리한테 뽐내고 싶어서 안달이 났어요.

en: The girl came dancing toward me.
ko: 여자애가 나를 향해 춤을 추며 다가왔어요.

en: The girls were not afraid, but the boys were.
The girl wore yellow ribbons in her hair.
ko: 그 여자애는 머리에 노란 리본을 달고 있었어요.

en: The girl insisted on being taken to the zoo.
ko: 그 여자애는 동물원에 데려가 달라고 떼를 썼어요.

en: Girls mature faster than boys.
The girl hugged her doll.
The girl didn't like to wash dishes.
The girl broke into tears.
Girls use makeup in their low teens.
ko: 여자애들은 십 대 초반부터 화장을 해요.

en: Almost all girls are kind.
Girls think much of fashion.
The girls are facing each other.
Girls like to show off their fine clothes.
ko: 여자애들은 예쁜 옷을 자랑하는 걸 좋아해요.

en: The girl was called Elizabeth after her grandmother.
ko: 그 여자애는 할머니 이름을 따서 엘리자베스라고 지었대요.

en: Both girls wear white suits.
ko: 두 여자애 모두 흰색 정장을 입고 있어요.

en: Both of the girls are wearing white suits.
ko: 그 여자애들은 둘 다 흰색 정장을 입고 있어요.

en: Some of the girls like that sort of music, and some don't.
ko: 여자애들 중에는 그런 음악을 좋아하는 애도 있고 안 좋아하는 애도 있어요.

en: Bob felt embarrassed when he was treated in front of some girls.
ko: 밥은 여자애들 앞에서 대접을 받으니까 쑥스러워했어요.

en: A little girl caught her fingers in the door.
Jeans are now in fashion among girls.
There is no stopping a girl's tongue.
What he said about girls holds true of boys, too.
ko: 그가 여자애들에 대해 한 말은 남자애들한테도 똑같이 해당돼.

en: Girl as she was, Joan was not daunted at all.
Keep an eye on the girls.
Keep an eye on the girls; they are poor swimmers.
ko: 여자애들 잘 지켜봐 줘, 수영을 잘 못하거든.

en: I saw a girl tumble and ran to her in spite of myself.
ko: 어떤 여자애가 넘어지는 걸 보고 나도 모르게 달려갔어.

en: The girl was heard to sing a song.
ko: 그 여자애가 노래 부르는 소리가 들렸어.

en: A girl should not sit with her legs crossed.
ko: 여자는 다리 꼬고 앉으면 안 돼.

en: A girl gave me an orange in exchange for a piece of cake.
ko: 어떤 여자애가 케이크 한 조각이랑 오렌지를 바꿔 줬어.

en: A woman's strength is in her tongue.
A woman asked me for directions.
Woman as she was, she was brave.
A woman thinks of everything in terms of money.
ko: 그 여자는 모든 걸 돈으로만 따져.

en: Women are always buying hats.
Three women and a goose make a market.
We want an assistant, preferably someone with experience.
ko: 보조 인원을 구하는데, 이왕이면 경력자가 좋겠어.

en: An expert was called for advice.
I tried to give him some advice, but he just abused me violently.
ko: 조언 좀 해주려다가 오히려 나한테 막말을 퍼붓더라고.

en: Advice isn't much good to me. I need money.
ko: 조언 같은 건 별로 도움 안 돼. 난 돈이 필요해.

en: It is important to help each other.
Give help to anyone who needs it.
ko: 도움이 필요한 사람에겐 누구든 도움을 줘.

en: I heard a cry for help.
Please send for help.
A call for help rang through the night.
There is no use crying for help. No one will hear you.
ko: 도와달라고 소리쳐봤자 소용없어. 아무도 못 들어.

en: There's no use crying for help. No one will hear you.
ko: 소리 질러봐야 소용없어. 아무도 안 들을 거야.

en: I had trouble making him hear me calling for help.
